website_summaries.verdict: The New Balance Fresh Foam Gobi Trail v2 was well-received by trail-running enthusiasts and other consumers. They welcomed its adequate width profiles, its agreeable color options, its affordability, and its versatility. But there were those who complained of heel slippage, inconsistent outsole durability, and an unstable midsole construction.
pros: Several consumers were happy to note that the New Balance Fresh Foam Gobi Trail v2 was able to give an agreeable fit
The design and color options for this running shoe were appreciated by those who have tested it
Some runners stated that it was efficient as both a running shoe and an option for daily walks
The durability and quality of the materials were held in high regard by a handful of people
This trail companion was lauded for being lightweight
cons: According to a few users, the heel area wasn’t able to lock the foot in place and that it tended to cause some slippage
Several runners claimed that the outsole tread peeled off after only a few uses
Based on some reviews, the underfoot platform could’ve benefited from an arch stabilizing mechanism

customer_reviews.title: Feels like part of my foot
customer_reviews.text: I have version 1 of the Fresh Foam Gobi and looked forward to version 2. The tongue in version 2 is attached to the rest of the shoe with elastic, embracing the foot and making the shoe feel like it's part of the foot. The Fresh Foam and the studs on the bottom of the shoe make it very comfortable and secure for walking or running on cement and dirt trails. Some of the reviews claim the shoe runs narrow but I think the snugness they feel is due to the attached tongue, which holds the shoe to the foot more snugly. In any case, my usual size and width fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: MindKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I thought these might be qa good fit and comfortable. WREONG!!I know most people who do not run, still buy running shoes for comfort. Well, I am glad I dont run! This one is way too hard! Small toe-box too. I always say, unless you spend at least 100-150$ for shoes, you get what you pay for. More expensive shoes usually mean better materials and design and comfort. I usually look for shoes in the 120-150 range and it always rings true! GO to a shoe store and try on the 150$ pair and tell me if I am wrong!
customer_reviews.author: P. Cappiello3

customer_reviews.title: Light, bright, breathable.
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm loving these. I need a larger toe-box and often NB's are the ticket. These in 10.5 2E seem a bit narrower than other 2E's I've tried, but with the laces tied rather loose they fit like a glove. They are light at 273g/9.6oz per shoe. The black/bolt colorway is bold and bright, and I've received some compliments on them after only a few uses. They've been good on gravel and easy dirt trail walks, but I think they'll prompt me to start running soon. The material seems to breathe better than some other NB's I've tried, so I have no complaints. Time will tell on durability.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R

customer_reviews.title: My new favorites!
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love these shoes! I have gotten several compliments from both men and women. I am a size 11 in women and got tired of going to shoe stores and never finding anything in my size. I took a look in the men’s section and found SO many options in a 9.5. I fell in love with this pair and ordered them on Amazon right away for less than it was in store. They did not fit with my Dr. Scholl’s insert, but I have been very comfortable in them anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Paige

customer_reviews.title: Great Hybrid Trail Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great hyrbrid trail shoe at a good price. A relatively simple, yet comfortable shoe from NB that does just as I wanted. Which was a shoe that could take me from the road to our relatively un-technical trails here in Florida.Not the shoe you would choose for a rocky or slippery area, but that is not what the shoe is designed for. Its great for road-to-trails in many urban or suburban parks. Also works as a rainy day road shoe when you need a little more grip than a road shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin D Hardwick

customer_reviews.title: Good cushioning and heel support
customer_reviews.text: After using ASCIS gel-cumulus from 15-17 versions, I want to try the fresh foam technology of New Balance. It didn't failed me on my expectations. Good cushioning and heel support. The sole spikes are modest enough for road run. A good choice for brief shift from road to trail to grass, especially if you run in various terrain in your area. I will start and follow this model/series 'till V3, V4...
customer_reviews.author: atp8888

customer_reviews.title: took a while to loosen up
customer_reviews.text: tight fit, some in between 9.5 and 10 size, narrow, but it works and after a while with use it is a favorite pair of shoes for a fraction of what other new balance shoes cost. could have used a bit more room, but they work well as expected. i would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Non Ostentatious
customer_reviews.text: Nice every day walk around shoe. The neutral colors don't grab attention. My shoes connect me to the ground, I don't need them to make a bold flashy statement. These do the perfect job for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: The 9s are very comfortable. Traction has been good on trails and dry ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes run a bit small. I wear 8D and ordered the 9 2E. The 9s are very comfortable. Traction has been good on trails and dry hard surfaces. They were not as reliable on damp or wet pavement, however that may be the pavement in my area. Overall very happy with the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W Sesler

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are great for what I paid. Quality seems very good. Fit is as expected and comfortable. I'll update if long term durability is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Gear User

customer_reviews.title: Bought for husband
customer_reviews.text: Bought for husband, he loves them but they're not good for driving long periods of time. Other than that he loves these shoes

customer_reviews.title: The most underrated trail shoe on the market.
customer_reviews.text: These are the most under rated shoes on the market. I have done several 100 mile races in these shoes, both trail and gravel. They also make great travel shoes as they can be used on road, trail, treadmill, and mixed. Plus they have amazing ware life. Also, as the colors are not all crazy I use my old ones as great ware around shoes.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Light and well balanced.
customer_reviews.text: New Balance shoes are now running small. I ordered the same shoe that had last year in same size and this time it was too small, so had to order this larger size. Great shoe, except for the sizing issue.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort Zone
customer_reviews.text: It's early but so far they've been great. Very comfortable, arch support, and forefoot rebound. I spend much of my day on my feet so it's crucial to have a comfortable pair of shoes. Laces are well done. May buy another pair just for running.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, i even used them to walk around ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, i even used them to walk around at work. Did over 10 miles just walking and standing for an normal shift. Super comfy out of the box. I ordered in the size that i have always wear my runnin shoes. Didn't have to go up or down.

On top of all that these colors are bright, sharp and full of life! You will not be disappointed with your purchase.

customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits very well, comfortable, shipping was quick and exactly as described. The owner is a Veteran and has a family, let's show our Thanks for his service and his families sacrifice and buy, buy, buy!

Note: Price varies depending on outside vendors price. I paid $59.95.
